Class ec.ifc.app.ECListView 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.ListView
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECListView
public class ECListView
extends ListView
implements ECKeyFilter
A subclass of ListView that supports moving the selection with up/down arrow keys.

ECListView()

keyDown(KeyEvent)
If the key was the up arrow, moves the selection to the previous item.
mouseUp(MouseEvent)
Overridden to make this list view the focused view
wantsEscapeKey()
Returns false so the cancel button (if any) can be activated
wantsReturnKey()
Returns false so the default button (if any) can be activated

ECListView 
  public ECListView()

keyDown 
  public void keyDown(KeyEvent event)
If the key was the up arrow, moves the selection to the previous item. If the key was the down arrow, moves the selection to the next item. If there was no selected item, or multiple selected items, or the list view is disabled, or any other key was pressed, does nothing.
Overrides:
keyDown in class View
mouseUp 
  public void mouseUp(MouseEvent event)
Overridden to make this list view the focused view
Overrides:
mouseUp in class ListView
wantsEscapeKey 
  public boolean wantsEscapeKey()
Returns false so the cancel button (if any) can be activated
wantsReturnKey 
  public boolean wantsReturnKey()
Returns false so the default button (if any) can be activated
